result.execSummary:
The defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vanessa Delray Fernandez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vanessa Delray Fernandez was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:39 PM Defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Vanessa Delray Fernandez.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates will plead to Count 1, Counts 2 and 3 will be dismissed, recommend 180 days imposed and stayed for 18 months probation, 13 days jail, 13 credit, DOC programming, $50 plus costs.
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Remaining counts are dismissed. 
Court orders 180 days imposed and stayed for 18 months probation, conditions of 13 days, 13 credit, time served, DOC programming $50 fine plus costs, bail applied.

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

03:11 PM Defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez in court.  Defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Vanessa Delray Fernandez appeared by video means.  Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Court indicates that Attorney Hoffman is able to make a special appearance. Defendant agrees.   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.  States request on bail: $1500 cash bail with conditions of  no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State indicates defendant does have F.T.A.'s. There is a new case in Ashland County and was scheduled for initial this morning. State did notify Ashland County of Defendant being in custody in our jail. State continues that lack of ties and new felony charges is the reason for cash bail is warranted.
Atty Hoffman questions defendant. Defendant does not have an employment. Defendant is not a resident of Douglas County. Defendant indicates she tested positive to Covid. Defendant thinks she can post $100.
Court has concerns of new pending charges and serious felonies here. Court Orders $1500 cash bail with conditions of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Court also has concerns about a positive Covid test, but does let defendant know she still has the right to have a hearing held within 10 days. Defendant would still like to have a hearing scheduled. Defendant will apply with Public Defenders office.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Oneida County - Cash bond and conditions
